Title(s): Wife of Bath’s Prologue; Canterbury Tales
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Wife of Bath’s Prologue of the Canterbury Tales — 856 lines in couplets, with some versions including additional lines.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
Experience though noon autoritewere in this world is right I nough
                    for me…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…if I haue licence of this worthi frereyis dame quod he telle
                    forth and I wol here
BodArcSelB14.Note:
III.381 omitted; includes 44a-f; spurious lines follow 332, 382; 488-9
                    inserted at foot.
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
Here bigynneth the wiff of Bathe hir prolog (f. 82v); the wiff
                    of Bathe (RT); Here endith the wiff of Bathe hir prolog… (f.
                        94v)
BodArcSelB14.Facsimiles:
Robinson,  Peter,
                        ed.  
             The Wife of Bath’s Prologue on CD-ROM.
         Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1996.
BodArcSelB14.Editions:
Robinson,  Peter,
                        ed.  
             The Wife of Bath’s Prologue on CD-ROM.
         Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1996.

BodBar20.First Lines:
Experiment though non autoriteWere in þis world is right I
                    nogh for me…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…Ȝif I haue licence of þis worthi frereȜis dame
                    coþ he telle forth I shal ȝoue here
BodBar20.Attributed Title: Here begynneth the Wyf of Bathe (f. 104); Of bathe (RT)

Bod414.First Lines:
[E]xperience though non auctoriteWere in this world is right enough
                    for me…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…If I haue licence of this wurthy frereyis dame telle furth
                    and I shalle here
Bod414.Attributed Title: The Prolog of the wif of Bathe (f. 64v)

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
Experiment þough noon auctoriteWere in þis worlde is
                    right I nough for me…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…And seide þeef þus mychel am I wrekeNow wil I die I
                    mai no lenger speke…
BodLauMis600.Note:
III.811-28 lost; 575-84, 609-12, 717-20 omitted; spurious lines follow
                    332. Fol. 88 is a seventh-century replacement leaf.
BodLauMis600.Attributed Title:
HEre begynneþ þe prolog of þe wif of Baþe (f.
                        75v); the prologe of baþe (RT)
BodLauMis600.Facsimiles:
Robinson,  Peter,
                        ed.  
             The Wife of Bath’s Prologue on CD-ROM.
         Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1996.

Robinson,  Peter,

             The Wife of Bath’s Prologue on CD-ROM.
         Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1996.

BodLauMis739.First Lines:
[E]xperience thogh noone auctoriteWere in this worlde is right
                    ynogh for me…
BodLauMis739.Last Lines:
…So blisse his soule for his mercy dereNow wold I seyn my tale
                    if ȝe will here
BodLauMis739.Note:
III.20, 230, 609-12, 619-26, 716-20, 739-48, 826-56 omitted; spurious
                    line follows 192. Lines 829-56, omitted in this MS, are supplied on
                    seventeenth-century added leaf, f. 140a).

BodRawPoe141.First Lines:
Experyence though non auctoriteWere in this worlde is ryght Inough
                    for me…
BodRawPoe141.Last Lines:
…Yif I haue licence of this worthy frereYes dame telle forth
                    your tale & I wol hit here
BodRawPoe141.Attributed Title:

                    Bathe (RT)

CULGg427.First Lines:
…But þis word is not take of euery wyghtBut þere as
                    god lust ȝeue it of hise myȝt…

…Ȝif I haue lycens of þis worþi frereȜis
                    dame telle forth & I schal here

                    Here endith þe prologe of the wyues tale of Bathe… (f. 222)

BLLan851.First Lines:
Than schortly ansewarde the wife of BathAnd swore a wonder grete
                    haþeBy goddes bones I wil tel nextI will nouht close bot say
                    þe textExperiment þouhe none auctoriteWhere in þis
                    werlde is riht y nouhe for me…
BLLan851.Last Lines:
…Ȝif I haue lycence of þis worþi frereȜis
                    dame quod he tell forþe þi tale I wil here
BLLan851.Note:
Four spurious lines added before III.1 to function as link (see above);
                    575-84, 609-12, 619-26, 717-20 omitted.
BLLan851.Attributed Title:
…Incipit prologus vxoris de Bath (f. 87); þe Wyf of
                    Baþe (RT)
BLLan851.Facsimiles:
Robinson,  Peter,
                        ed.  
             The Wife of Bath’s Prologue on CD-ROM.
         Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1996.

Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             The Lansdowne Manuscript of Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales.
Chaucer Society
         Series 1, nos. 7, 13, 20, 36, 43, 55, 69. London: Trübner,
            1868-79. 
Robinson,  Peter,

BLRoy17Dxv.First Lines:

BLRoy18Cii.First Lines:
Oure oost gan tho to loke vp anonGode men quod he herkeneth
                    euerichonAs euere mote I drynk wyn or aleThis marchande hath I tolde a
                    mery taleHow Ianuarie hadde a lither IapeHis wyf put in his hood an
                    apeBut hereof I wil leue of as nowDame wyf of Bath quod he I pray
                    ȝowTelle vs a tale now next after þisSire oost quod she so
                    god my soule blisAs I fully therto wil consenteAnd also it is myn hole
                    ententeTo done ȝow alle disporte as þat I canBut holde me
                    excused I am a womanI can not reherse as these clerkes kuneAnd
                    riȝt anon she hath hir tal byguneExperience though noon
                    auctoriteWere in þis world is right I nowȝ for
                    me…
BLRoy18Cii.Last Lines:
…So blesse his sowle for his mercy dereNow wole I seyn my tale
                    if ȝe wil here…
BLRoy18Cii.Note:
Sixteen spurious lines precede III.1 to function as link; 190; 575-84,
                    609-12, 619-26, 717-20, 739-48, 829-56 omitted; blank line follows 192 with
                        ‘deficit’ in margin.
BLRoy18Cii.Attributed Title:
…The prolog of the Wyf of Bathe (f. 105, margin); Here endith the
                    prolog And begynneth the tale (f. 105, following spurious lines added as link
                    [see above]) The Wyf of Bathe (RT)

             The Wife of Bath’s Prologue on CD-ROM.
